chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 10:16 AM Defendant Kaleah K Thomas in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court provides defendant with the Petition for Court appointed Counsel.  Court takes recess at 10:17 am.  Case recalled at 10:23 am with the same appearances.    Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing May 1, 2022.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 02/23/2022.
Hearing on March 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, with the exception of an emergency and in their official capacity.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

02:55 PM Defendant Kaleah K Thomas in court by telephone means, in custody at the Waukesha County Jail, with attorney Eryn M Menden, in person.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Court will provide the defendant with the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel and the deputies sent the documentation to the jail after Court.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
